metadata.title: USN-5431-1 -- GnuPG vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that GnuPG was not properly processing keys with large amounts of signatures. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5431-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  dirmngr - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgv-static - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgv-win32 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 scdaemon - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgsm - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgv - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpg - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gnupg-agent - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gnupg2 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgconf - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpgv2 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gnupg-utils - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpg-wks-server - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpg-agent - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gnupg - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gpg-wks-client - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 gnupg-l10n - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.5 No subscription required
